clinical_study.brief_title: Effectivity and Safety of Ultrasound-guided Percutaneously Radiofrequency Ablation for Liver Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of ultrasonography (US) -guided radiofrequency ablation for liver tumors, the investigators used preoperative and postoperative US/CEUS(contrast-enhanced ultrasonography)/CT/MRI to assess lesions, and laboratory tests including the tumor markers to evaluate the general condition of patients. Intraoperative US/CEUS/CT would be applied to monitor ablation lesions.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
primary_outcome.description: Tumor size was estimated by MRI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Carcinoembryonic Antigen (CEA) level assessed by ELISA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: CEA level was assessed by enzyme linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Alpha Fetoprotein (AFP) level assessed by ELISA
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 year
secondary_outcome.description: AFP level was assessed by ELISA.

arm_group.description: The investigators used percutaneously US-guided RFA(radiofrequency ablation) for small hepatocellular carcinoma,and estimated the safety and efficacy of this treatment through 2-year follow-up of US/CEUS/CT/MRI and the tumor markers.

intervention.description: The investigators used percutaneously US-guided radiofrequency ablation for patients with small hepatocellular carcinoma,and estimated the safety and efficacy of this treatment through 2-year follow-up of US/CEUS/CT/MRI and the tumor markers.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with small hepatocellular carcinoma (single or multiple nodules of less than 3 cm in diameter), Patients with Child-Pugh A/B, Patients with PLT(platelet count) ≥ 50*10e9/L and PT(prothrombin time) ≤ 20s.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with blood coagulation dysfunction, ChildPugh score≥3, severe cardiopulmonary disease, intolerant anesthesia and upper gastrointestinal bleeding in shock.
